description:
Currently, pause and unpause functionality is not supported by the vmware api. Issuing the nova pause command works but does not give any indication of success or failure. Attempting to pause an instance via Horizon gives a success message but the instance stays ACTIVE.

Relevant nova log snippet:

comments.content: this is expected, VMware API doesn't support pause operation officially. so we can't expose this to OpenStack.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~heut2008

comments.content: For background: this is pause/unpause networking traffic to the VM. This is not the same as suspend/unsuspend.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hartsock

comments.content: Thanks for clarifying Yaguang and Shawn. Is there anything we can do to notify the end-user that pause/unpause isn't implemented (In Horizon, if you select pause, it will give a green success message)?
